Oktober, Posisi Cadangan Devisa Indonesia Capai 126,7 Miliar Dollar
07 Nov 2019, 10:53 by Magdalena


Oktober, Posisi Cadangan Devisa Indonesia Capai 126,7 Miliar Dollar

KBRN, Jakarta :  Posisi cadangan devisa Indonesia pada akhir Oktober 2019 mengalami peningkatan dibandingkan bulan September.Laporan Bank Indonesia yang dirilis Kamis (7/11/2019) menunjukkan, posisi cadangan devisa Indonesia pada bulan Oktober  2019 tercatat sebesar 126,7 miliar dolar AS, sedangkan posisi cadangan devisa pada akhir September 2019 sebesar 124,3 miliar dolar AS. Posisi cadangan devisa tersebut setara dengan pembiayaan 7,4 bulan impor atau 7,1 bulan impor dan pembayaran utang luar negeri pemerintah, serta berada di atas standar kecukupan internasional sekitar 3 bulan impor. Bank Indonesia menilai cadangan devisa tersebut mampu mendukung ketahanan sektor eksternal serta menjaga stabilitas makroekonomi dan sistem keuangan.Peningkatan cadangan devisa pada Oktober 2019, menurut laporan BI, terutama dipengaruhi oleh penerbitan global bond pemerintah, penerimaan devisa migas, dan penerimaan valas lainnya. Ke depan, Bank Indonesia memandang cadangan devisa tetap memadai dengan didukung stabilitas dan prospek ekonomi yang tetap baik.Informasi mengenai perkembangan posisi cadangan devisa ini penting, karena menjadi salah satu alat untuk menjaga dan menstabilkan nilai tukar rupiah.

October, Indonesia's Foreign Exchange Reserve Position Reaches 126.7 Billion Dollars
Nov. 7, 2019, 10:53 by Magdalena


October, Indonesia's Foreign Exchange Reserve Position Reaches 126.7 Billion Dollars

KBRN, Jakarta: The position of Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves at the end of October 2019 has increased compared to September. Bank Indonesia's report released on Thursday (11/07/2019) shows that Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves in October 2019 were recorded at 126.7 billion US dollars, while the position of foreign exchange reserves at the end of September 2019 was 124.3 billion US dollars. The foreign exchange reserves are equivalent to financing 7.4 months of imports or 7.1 months of imports and payment of government foreign debt, and are above the international adequacy standard of about 3 months of imports. Bank Indonesia assesses that foreign exchange reserves are able to support the resilience of the external sector and maintain macroeconomic and financial system stability. The increase in foreign exchange reserves in October 2019, according to the BI report, was mainly influenced by the issuance of government global bonds, oil and gas foreign exchange receipts, and other foreign exchange receipts. Going forward, Bank Indonesia views that foreign exchange reserves remain adequate with the support of stability and good economic prospects. Information on the development of foreign exchange reserves is important, because it becomes one of the tools to maintain and stabilize the rupiah exchange rate.
